evidence.pdf_reference: for the conversion of CO 2 to aldehyde.No photochemical catalytic activity was observed for the alkyl-capped SiNCs (alkyl-SiNCs).A mechanism for the photocatalytic properties associated with the photoluminescent characteristics of these two types of SiNCs was tentatively proposed.

used as photocatalysts for CO 2 reduction.The high efficiency of the photocatalytic reduction of CO 2 observed in this report might be due to the dispersion of the SiNCs in the reaction medium, which exposes a larger surface area than when nanocrystals are fixed on a membrane or substrate 6,20.However, it is more promising using no-SiNCs because HEBM is easily scalable.

the no-SiNCs did not show any fluorescence because the photogenerated holes and electrons reacted with H 2 O and CO 2 , respectively, and no electron-hole recombination occurred to emit light. We propose a mechanism for the photocatalysis of CO 2 reduction by the no-SiNCs that is essentially the same as photocatalysis by H-SiNCs because both nanocrystals are easily oxidized under experimental conditions.The SiNCs are small in size and slightly oxidized, but they can still be used as photocatalysts for CO 2

box under argon atmosphere.The silicon powders were dispersed in ethanol or water and passed through a 220 nm syringe filter. 2a, red curve).These results proved that the reduction of CO 2 was driven by light with the no-SiNCs as a photocatalyst.In this work, the light source was filtered through a sunlight filter; only visible and near-UV light were responsible for the photo excitation reaction.The formation of formaldehyde demonstrated that the no-SiNCs were an efficient photocatalyst for the reduction of CO 2 , similar behavior was observed for other NCs 20.In our work, the amount of formaldehyde increased in an almost linear
